textAfterTable: --> Algal Biofuel Laboratory Algal biofuels have the potential to solve many of the sustainability challenges facing other biofuels today. Shown here is a laboratory where research works to drive down the cost of large-scale algal biofuel production. Algal Biofuel Laboratory B-Roll Format Length File Size Preview reel .WMV 5:18 19 MB Full-length HD video .WMV 5:18 189 MB Full-length HD video .MOV 5:18 528 MB Cellulosic Biomass Biorefinery — South Dakota Cellulosic biomass—like trees and grasses—is not generally used as a food source and can be used as feedstock for ethanol production. Here, a pilot cellulosic biomass biorefinery in South Dakota uses biochemical conversion technology to produce fuel-grade ethanol from cellulosic feedstocks. Cellulosic Biomass Biorefinery — South Dakota B-Roll Format Length File Size Preview reel .WMV 5:43 21 MB Full-length HD video .WMV 5:43 213
